messages: 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (06:33): i just got a new thing in chrome. on the preferences icon (where usually the yellow circle pops up when chrome needs to be updated) i had some kind of blue tilde icon. it did point to the background pages window but i saw absolutely nothing wrong there.
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (06:33): i thought maybe something crashed, but all my tabs seem to be fine
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (06:33): and i can't find anything about it on the web.
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (06:34): lol i installed dev version half my page disappeared :)

4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (06:36): 2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480, i use dev version all the time. seems to work just fine. there were times where i could not open devtools almost anywhere (the tab would just crash) and there was a bug when you could not scroll up (seriously). but other then that, it is more stable than other browsers' stable versions. :-)
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (06:36): what page dissapeared?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:37): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596: tbh i dont know whats up with that background pages icon
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:37): bg pages are used by extensions
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (06:37): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, but do you see it as well?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:37): but no idea why it needs to be exposed on the wrench
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (06:39): hm, maybe some extension crashed.
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (06:39): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, this new chrome://settings is sexy
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:56): 2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480: how *should* i do a boilerplate talk.
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (06:57): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: Good question, is this talk specifically for just that?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:58): intro to the idea. what it's goals are.. highlights of the markup and css..
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:58): modernizr highlights.
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (06:58): remember, obviously you do lol, the video walkthrough you did for it?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:58): apache highlights.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:58): build script concept.
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (06:59): that video was awesome, very fun and informative
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (06:59): ill try to be drunk for the talk then
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (06:59): LOL that was gret
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (07:00): the more in depth parts of the boilerplate, like you mention, build scripts etc, would be helpful to hear more about
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (07:00): those pieces i dont really follow
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:02): sucks as a mockup designer
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (07:03): gonna use it to build into html5 info? cutting edge crap we should be using? :)
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:10): YEAH CUTTING EDGE SHIT
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:12): probably some polyfill like crazy type shit

0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:12): with ARIA stuff, do you guys limit what you put in? or just put in whatever assistive standards will eventually be so you're ready when the technology finally gets updated?
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (07:12): polyfill stuff would be rd
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:14): 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17: i put in anything that NVDA will be responsive to.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:15): let the other ones catch up
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:15): NVDA is the target, for all intents and purposes.
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (07:16): i was putting role tags on a client site earlier
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (07:31): hey guys, need your help. give me some definition of polyfill so i could translate it to russian, please. :-)
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (07:32): I didn't know what it even meant until 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 filled me in on it a couple months back
1a89081c023753af2ac12db36ffb4608 (07:32): poly-filled me in
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:32): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596: so polyfill is like a shim..
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:32): json2.js is a good example of a polyfill
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:33): it has the exact same API of native JSON... and only adds itself to the page if native support is not present.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:33): all polyfills are code that is expected to expire. as soon as the browsers are upgraded.
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (07:33): is the term degradative?
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (07:34): we have a term for that in russian (the exact translation would be crutches) but it is a bit degradative so i don't know if i should use it
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (07:34): hm
2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480 (07:35): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596: dont worry we gonna get our learn on in two weeks :D
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (07:36): 2d1e55eae334050f5c370c7c592b0480, i am translating boilerplate site to russian, gonna learn this shit earlier.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (07:39): i think a crutches type idea is pretty accurate
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (07:44): ?tell 0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 that he has the wisest quit message i've ever seen. and the most serious. :-P
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (07:44): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596, Okay.
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (07:45): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, ok, crutches it is then.
